original_title: Guglielmo Oberdan, il martire di Trieste
overview: Guglielmo Oberdan, the martyr of Trieste, already exemplary figure of fervent irredentist, then anti-Austrian conspirator executed for attempting to assassinate Emperor Franz Joseph after the disillusionment that followed the death of Garibaldi (1882), became, in 1915, the symbol of a civil case of patriotism.
title: Guglielmo Oberdan, il martire di Trieste
